climbs.name: Wicked Witch
climbs.fa: Marty Hornick, Chris Boor 1988. Retobolts: Eric & Crystal Anderson, 2002

content.description:
Another line on the Oz formation that was originally done all-gear; this one has been fully retobolted. At least 3 of them are completely unnecessary IMO, as they are adjacent to a crack. A fun line regardless of the ethics.

Face climbing up vertical layaway edges (crux) leads to a crack. Follow the discontinuous crack up and finish with more face climbing.
content.location: Right-most bolted route on the North face, at the top of the trail as it goes uphill and ends at a big boulder.

content.description: Climb the boulder to the first bolt, then move onto the main face. Climb the right-leaning crack/seam until it's too thin, then face climb straight up, then angle right to the anchor
content.protection:
6 bolts, open shuts

Shares anchor with,

" if I only had a brain "
content.location:
First route on the left side of the North face.

10 ft. Right of " Heartless "

climbs.name: If I only had a Brain

content.description: Awesome edges up the steep face. Crux is a big reach at the 2nd bolt. I'd give it more stars if it was longer, cause it's pretty fun for how short it is!
content.protection:
4 bolts, open shuts

Shares anchor with " Munchkin Land "
content.location: 2nd route from the left on the north face. Start at the top of the boulder / block that " Munchkin Land " starts on, up & to the right.  7ft. left of " Flying Monkeys "

climbs.name: Flying Monkeys
climbs.fa: Marty Hornick & Chris Boor 1998 GU. -  retrobolts, Crystal & Erik Anderson, 2004

content.description: Steep face on good rock, with fun edges and a short, but really fun crack/ flake section
content.location: Center of the North face, just left of, and shares a couple of holds at the start with "Wicked Witch"

content.description: Climb up the corner using stemming, the finger crack, and face holds.
content.location: Far right side of the north face, rap rings.
